title: Electrostatics - compare fields near two charges

content.question: Two small spheres are arranged along a line and have charges of <math alttext="negative 3 uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and <math alttext="positive 4 uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, as shown in the figure. The tick marks on the axis are equally spaced. At which of the labeled tick marks does the electric field have the greatest magnitude?

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
